intro: Lophostigma plumosum, commonly known as the silky lichen, is a unique organism that belongs to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its dense, velvety growth form, which gives it a soft, almost fuzzy appearance. The thallus of this lichen is typically bright yellow to orange in color, with a distinctive, branched structure. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found on tree bark or soil in tropical and subtropical regions. Its morphology and coloration make it easily identifiable among other lichen species.
